By VisitBucksCounty.com • Special to The Cardinal

Whether getting active on a bike ride to New Hope for a stout or finding “lucky” shopping and dining deals with the family, there’s always a way to celebrate St. Patrick’s Day in Bucks County. 

Beer Tasting: Celtic Brews

At the Washington House Hotel and Restaurant on March 5th – Pair your meal with these English, Irish and Scottish beer styles and take the opportunity to sample some beers that may be new to you! Join up every first Friday for a themed Beer Tasting!

Crossing Vineyards and Winery

Ireland Forever!   

Thursday, March 17, 6 pm to 9 pm.

Tired of the same old Paddy’s Party places? Try Crossing Vineyards this year. They’ve got Irish music, drink specials and treats from their “Flights and Bites” menu. Draft beer and house wines, just $5. If you come “wearin’ the green,” you’ll get a coupon for a BOGO wine tasting. Erin Go Bragh!

Newtown Shamrock Shuffle

This Shamrock Shuffle offers more than your typical 5K. Once you finish running through historic Newtown, you are invited to keep the party going! In lieu of the Irish Festival this year they are beginning a Shuffle through Newtown where participating bars, restaurants, and shops will be offering specials and giveaways.

Newtown Irish Festival

At The Green Parrot Restaurant – The Festival will feature Live Bands, Irish Dancers, Irish Food and Fare.  It will be for all ages and families and will include Scott the Balloon artist from Myers Designs LLC who makes Balloon Animals like Leprechauns, Shamrocks, Parrots, Cartoon Characters, Superheroes and more! 

Ninth Annual Shake Your Shamrock Run

Join Scoogie Events & Peddler’s Village along with Hewn Spirits Distillery & Bucks County Brewery for the biggest & best family St. Patrick’s Day celebration around!

Bucks County St. Patty’s Day Parade

The Bucks County St. Patrick’s Day Parade will kick off on March 12th, 2022 at 10:30 am. The parade begins at Conwell-Egan Catholic High School and ends at the Levittown American baseball fields on New Falls Road.

Celebrate the Green

In honor of St Patrick’s Day, Peddler’s Village presents Celebrate the Green, a mid-March opportunity to enjoy special menus, promotions, and comedy-themed events. 

ShadyBrook Farm St. Paddy’s unWINEd Weekend

Come out of hibernation and celebrate the luck of the Irish at Shady Brook Farm with the St. Paddy’s unWINEd Weekend! They’ll have live music, Irish dancers, Irish food, drinks and fun ALL weekend long! This event takes places in The Barn and a big tent and there will be outside activities for the kiddos (weather permitting).

https://shadybrookfarm.com/unwined

For more information on any of these events visit https://www.visitbuckscounty.com/events/st-patricks-day/?
